items: Find a sturdy pull-up bar that can support your body weight without any risk of falling or bending.
Stand below the pull-up bar and jump or reach up to grab it with an underhand (supinated) grip, with your hands positioned shoulder-width apart.
Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended, ensuring your feet are off the ground and your body is in a straight line.
Begin to pull your body upwards by engaging your lats and biceps, while simultaneously raising your knees towards your chest or elbows.
Continue pulling yourself up until your chin is above the bar, and your knees or thighs are as close to your chest or elbows as possible.
Hold the top position briefly, focusing on maintaining proper form and engaging your core.
Slowly lower your body back down to the starting position, extending your arms fully and lowering your knees back down.
Repeat the Gorilla Chin exercise for the desired number of repetitions or sets, ensuring proper form and control throughout the movement.
Rest and recover between sets as needed, and consider incorporating this exercise into a well-rounded upper body or full-body workout routine.
Can be modified for different fitness levels
